meanings.definition: To remove a muffler or covering from
meanings.sent1: I will unmuffle the car to make it louder.
meanings.sent2: Please unmuffle the microphone before speaking.
meanings.sent3: The magician will now unmuffle the hidden bird from his hat.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to unmuffle her true feelings to the world.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to unmuffle the beauty of the landscape.

meanings.definition: To make less muffled or muted
meanings.sent1: Let's unmuffle the music so we can hear it better.
meanings.sent2: He tried to unmuffle his voice to be heard across the room.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat seemed to unmuffle its purring as it woke up.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to unmuffle the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The fresh air helped to unmuffle the sounds of nature around them.
